subject: Travel
title: The Maya Collapse
description: A fast breakdown of The Maya Collapse for builders.

hook.text: The Maya built pyramids, invented zero, and tracked Venus to within minutes. Then millions vanished from their cities.

buildup.text: Between 800 and 1000 AD, dozens of major Maya cities were abandoned across Central America.

discovery.text: Soil samples reveal severe deforestation. The Maya cut so many trees that rainfall patterns changed.

twist.text: The people didn't actually vanish. Millions of Maya descendants live in Guatemala and Mexico today.

climax.text: Their cities fell, but their culture survived. Maya languages are spoken by six million people right now.

punchline.text: The Maya never disappeared. Only their cities did.

quiz.question: What happened to the Maya people?
options: They abandoned their cities but millions of descendants live today
